definition: salad with dressing/cold vegetables dressed with sauce (e.g. coleslaw)

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
to mix/to mix in/to toss (a salad)

sentences.english: We dined on chicken, potatoes, salad and apple-pie.
sentences.chinese: 正餐我们吃的是鸡，土豆，凉拌菜和苹果馅饼。

sentences.english: I've ordered savory pork and cole slaw.
sentences.chinese: 我点了咸猪肉和凉拌生菜丝。

sentences.english: Woman: I've ordered savory pork and coleslaw.
sentences.chinese: 我叫的是美味猪肉和凉拌卷心菜。

sentences.english: Onions must be chopped up to make a salad.
sentences.chinese: 要做凉拌菜得把洋葱剁碎。

sentences.english: My chicken salad isn't here yet.
sentences.chinese: 我点的凉拌鸡现在还没上上来。

sentences.english: Pre-prepared or stored salads, including coleslaw.
sentences.chinese: 前的准备或储存的沙拉，包括凉拌卷心菜。
我要一份凉拌高丽沙拉。

sentences.english: The coleslaw had a bit of a kick, which was appreciated by the judges.
sentences.chinese: 在凉拌卷心菜了一个踢，这是由法官赞赏位。

sentences.english: According to reflect, dumplings and guizhou flavor of salad vegetables, especially popular.
sentences.chinese: 据反映来看，水饺和贵州风味的凉拌蔬菜特别受欢迎。

sentences.english: He ordered cold preserved eggs for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 晚餐时，他要了一个凉拌变蛋。

sentences.english: Summer can be cold in winter while hot cooking, ages.
sentences.chinese: 夏可凉拌，冬则热烹，老少皆宜。

sentences.english: I don't need to, you know, learn to eat coleslaw and cold beef.
sentences.chinese: 你看，我不需要去学着吃凉拌卷心菜和冷牛排。

definition: to stir-fry with oil only (no addition of water)
way of eating/how something is eaten/how a dish is prepared/the way a dish is to be cooked
